translator.notice: Caution: This application relies on a research-based translation engine that may provide inaccurate results.  If you speak Tamazight, you can help us improve by submitting translations.

page_intro.title: Internet Speaks Amazic
page_intro.CTA_text: Awal is an initiative driven by the community to promote the Tamazight language in the digital world. Our mission is simple: to see how Amazigh is spoken and understood in the digital world with open-source technology, and we need your collaboration to achieve this.
page_intro.text_1: For each translation recorded in Awal, you will earn points and be able to see how you compare with other community members.
page_intro.text_2: Contribution is open to anyone who can read and/or write in Amazigh. We celebrate the rich diversity of Amazigh variants and welcome speakers from all backgrounds
page_intro.text_3: Visit our resources page to access open data sets resulting from our collective efforts and discover other projects actively contributing to the preservation of Amazigh.
page_intro.text_4: Learn more about the community driving Awal on our 'About Us' page. Join our Facebook, Telegram, and WhatsApp groups to connect with other volunteers, share progress, seek guidance, and be part of a support network.
page_intro.item_1_normal: Show off your linguistic skills by translating sentences to or from Amazigh in your own words.
page_intro.item_2_normal: Validate the translations made by other volunteers, ensuring the accuracy of the resulting technology
page_intro.item_3_normal: Contribute with speech data through Common Voice, give Amazigh a voice in the digital world.
